intro: Archiserratula forrestii, commonly known as the Tibetan thistle, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features robust, hairy stems and broad, serrated leaves that are adapted to withstand harsh, arid conditions. Its flowers are typically purple or pink, adding vibrant color to its alpine habitat. Archiserratula forrestii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain herbivores.
